title: Hilary Knight: Women's team joke 'distasteful'
content: American gold medalist Hilary Knight called President Trump's comment about the women's team "distasteful" but said she chooses to celebrate the women's accomplishments.

title: Cincy sues transfer QB Sorsby over $1M exit fee

title: Banned by NBA, Porter joins USBL's SuperHawks
content: Jontay Porter, banned for life by the NBA for gambling in 2024 and currently awaiting sentencing after pleading guilty to a related federal charge, is planning to play for an upstart pro basketball league.

title: PM Modi becomes first world leader to cross 100 million Instagram followers
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has achieved a historic milestone. He is now the first world leader to surpass 100 million followers on Instagram. This achievement highlights his significant global digital reach. Modi's follower count far exceeds other prominent world leaders. His popularity continues to grow worldwide.

title: India, Israel likely to ink MoU on tech transfer for Iron Dome, Iron Beam, advanced missiles
content: India and Israel are poised to sign a landmark defense agreement, focusing on technology transfer for advanced weapons systems. The deal aims to bolster India's missile defense capabilities with Israeli systems like Iron Dome and Iron Beam, enhancing its security against aerial threats and fortifying its borders.

title: 4 passengers of US speedboat shot dead by Cuban coast guard
content: Cuba's coastguard shot dead four people and injured six others travelling in a US-registered speedboat in an exchange of fire off the Cuban coast on Wednesday, the interior ministry in Havana said. As a coastguard vessel approached to identify the boat "shots were fired from the boat," injuring the commander of the Cuban vessel, the ministry added.

title: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza 15 runs away from making T20I history vs India
content: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza is on the verge of a historic T20I milestone, needing just 15 runs to become the first Zimbabwean to reach 3000 international runs. He aims to achieve this in their crucial Super Eight match against defending champions India.  This encounter is vital for both teams' semi-final aspirations in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

title: 'Can‚Äôt let craziest regime to have nuclear weapons': JD Vance ahead of US-Iran talks in Geneva
content: US Vice President JD Vance stated that the Trump administration is committed to preventing Iran, described as the world's "craziest and worst regime," from obtaining nuclear weapons. While prioritizing diplomacy, Vance emphasized that President Trump possesses other tools to achieve this goal, urging Iran to take negotiations seriously.

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra launched: Price, specifications and all details
content: Samsung has unveiled its latest flagship, the Galaxy S26 Ultra, featuring a groundbreaking Privacy Display for enhanced data protection. This new device boasts a powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip, an impressive 200MP camera system, and a 5,000mAh battery with 60W fast charging. Pre-orders are now open, with the phone available in several striking colours.

title: 'Does not make sense': India coach drops verdict on Abhishek Sharma's poor form
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak backs under-pressure openers Abhishek Sharma and Tilak Varma ahead of their must-win T20 World Cup match against Zimbabwe. Kotak believes both players are close to finding form, emphasizing that focusing too much on individual struggles can be detrimental. He defended Varma's strike rate, citing specific match situations and team strategy.

title: HP feels pressure as company says RAM prices are nearly one-third of total PC cost
content: HP Inc. is experiencing a significant surge in PC material costs, with RAM now accounting for 35% of the bill of materials, up from 15-18% last quarter. This rise is expected to impact Personal Systems Operating Profit margins, though HP is implementing cost-saving measures and strategic inventory management to mitigate the effects.

title: Sanju Samson all set to feature in India‚Äôs must-win clash vs Zimbabwe
content: Defending champions India are considering changes to their opening partnership for a crucial Super Eights match against Zimbabwe. With qualification on the line after a loss to South Africa, wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson is a potential option to address struggles at the top of the order, particularly Abhishek Sharma's lean run.

title: ‚ÄòSorry Papa, galti se ho gaya‚Äô: Lucknow teen‚Äôs apology after shooting, dismembering father
content: A 19-year-old son allegedly shot his pathologist father with a licensed rifle following an argument over NEET preparation. He then dismembered the body, concealed parts in a drum and plastic, and dumped them. The accused confessed after police grew suspicious of his behavior.

title: Google says sorry for BAFTA news alert; that said: See more on ‚Ä¶
content: Google has issued a formal apology after a news notification containing a racial slur was sent to users. The alert was related to an involuntary outburst of the N-word by an audience member with Tourette syndrome during the BAFTAs. Google stated the error was a system malfunction, not AI-generated, and has since removed the offensive notification.

title: AI protest: 20 Delhi cops detained in Himachal, freed & stopped again after Youth Congress arrests
content: A jurisdictional dispute erupted after Shimla Police filed an FIR against Delhi Police personnel for allegedly abducting three Youth Congress members. The Delhi team was detained, released by a court, and then detained again, escalating tensions between the two state police forces.

title: India with Israel & world for dialogue, peace, stability: PM Modi
content: Addressing the Israeli Knesset, Prime Minister Narendra Modi firmly backed Israel on terrorism, condemning the Oct 7 attacks and naming Hamas. He asserted India's unwavering support, emphasizing a zero-tolerance policy against terror, drawing parallels to the 26/11 Mumbai attacks. Modi also endorsed the UNSC-backed Gaza peace initiative, highlighting the need for dialogue, peace, and stability in the region.

title: Candace Owens sparks backlash with ‚ÄúBride of Charlie‚Äù series on Erika Kirk
content: Candace Owens has stirred major controversy after releasing the trailer for her YouTube investigative series The Bride of Charlie, centered on Erika Kirk. The preview quickly went viral, prompting backlash, intense online debate, and questions directed at Charlie Kirk‚Äôs allies. While supporters call it accountability journalism, critics warn it risks harassment and speculation, as silence from prominent conservative voices fuels growing tension.

title: Josh Allen & Hailee Steinfeld 2026 combined net worth and earnings breakdown
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen and actress Hailee Steinfeld are a prominent couple who got married in 2025 and expecting their first child. Their combined net worth is estimated at $125 million in 2026, with Allen's NFL contracts and endorsements forming the bulk of their wealth, complemented by Steinfeld's successful entertainment career.

title: Winner of Beast Games Season 2: Tyler Lucas Wins $5.1M Prize
content: Tyler Lucas won Beast Games Season 2 on February 24, 2026, taking home $5.1 million after choosing the correct suitcase in the finale. The season awarded more than $11 million overall to the top contestants. Lucas, a former Air Force pilot and Penn State player, confirmed his win on X, while MrBeast highlighted the record-breaking payouts.

title: Divided Israeli parties unite to welcome PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi's Israel visit fostered rare bipartisan support, with opposition leader Yair Lapid calling him a true friend. PM Netanyahu and his wife extended a special airport welcome, highlighting strong India-Israel bonds. Modi received the Knesset's highest honor, underscoring broad political consensus on deepening ties despite internal divisions.

title: Day 2 of DefSAT conference witnesses 6 MoUs exchanges among space companies
content: Defence experts at DefSat2026 stressed India's need for a robust space capability amidst global military space infrastructure growth. Discussions highlighted that persistent space power is now vital for national security, not just an ambition. The conference also saw significant B2B collaborations, with six MoUs signed, underscoring private sector confidence in India's defence space sector.

title: Donald Trump confirms Team USA women‚Äôs Winter Olympics White House honor
content: Donald Trump announced during his State of the Union address that the Team USA women‚Äôs Olympic hockey champions will visit the White House later. The women won gold by beating Canada in overtime. The men also won gold and already visited the White House. USA Hockey earlier cited schedule conflicts for the women‚Äôs absence but thanked Trump for the honor.

title: The 4 pm energy crash: What it says about your metabolism
content: Many experience a 4 pm slump, but it's not laziness. Experts explain that this dip in alertness stems from our body's natural 24 - hour clock, influenced by lunch choices, stress, and sleep debt.  Understanding these biological cues can help manage energy levels effectively, rather than just reaching for caffeine.

title: Brock Lesnar children shine as Turk follows Mya Lesnar with hockey heroics
content: Turk Lesnar, son of wrestling star Brock Lesnar, is making a name for himself in junior hockey. He recently scored a hat trick for the Calgary Rockies U17 team. This follows his sister Mya's national title in shot put. The Lesnar family continues its legacy of athletic achievement. Brock Lesnar is also expected at WrestleMania 42.

title: Mary Cosby‚Äôs son Robert Cosby Jr. passes away at 23
content: Robert Cosby Jr., the son of Mary Cosby of 'The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City' has passed away. He was just 23. Although an official cause of death is still unknown, TMZ reports that authorities acknowledged that they initially responded to a 'possible overdose'

title: Kayla Nicole‚Äôs bold remark on Taylor Swift before Kelce wedding
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have always stayed pretty private about their future plans. As the two plan their lavish wedding, Kayla Nicole's controversial comments about the billionaire pop star has resurfaced where she makes a dig at her for some of her lyrics that might have hinted at Travis Kelce's relationship with his ex girlfriend. Both Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have stayed silent about this.

title: On track to develop locally-made marine engine for Navy by 2028: Kirloskar co CEO
content: Kirloskar Oil Engines is on track to deliver India's first indigenously developed 6 MW marine engine to the Indian Navy by April 2028. This initiative, under the 'Make-I' category, aims to achieve self-reliance in marine engine manufacturing, reducing dependence on foreign suppliers and strengthening domestic defense capabilities.

title: UAE urgently recalls 4 health products: What every consumer must know
content: UAE health authorities have urgently recalled four products, including three supplements and one medical item, due to serious safety concerns like unapproved ingredients and contamination. Consumers are warned against purchasing or using these. The recall of the supplements and health product highlights the nation's commitment to public health and strict regulatory enforcement.

title: Joe Burrow spends $1 million as Olivia Ponton takes fresh life reset
content: Joe Burrow and popular model, Olivia Ponton, have been rumroed to be in a relationship with each other since the end of 2024. As the Bengals' star player Joe Burrow recovers from a pretty brutal season on the field, it seems his rumored girlfriend Olivia Ponton has taken a break in her life as she posted about taking a reset.

title: Quote of the day by Keanu Reeves: ‚ÄòIf you're a lover, you've gotta be a fighter‚Äô
content: "If you're a lover, you've gotta be a fighter"... Keanu Reeves said this famous quote on 'The Drew Barrymore Show' in 2021. In Keanu‚Äôs philosophy, "fighting" isn't about physical aggression, but rather the effort, commitment, and resilience required to maintain and protect a deep bond.

title: Dubai Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan‚Äôs emotional birthday tribute to son Mohammed
content: Dubai's Crown Prince, Fazza, captivated millions with a touching video montage celebrating his son Mohammed's third birthday. The heartwarming compilation, shared on Instagram, beautifully chronicled the young prince's journey from infancy to toddlerhood, featuring intimate family moments. This deeply personal tribute resonated globally, highlighting universal themes of family, time and parental pride.

title: Flying through Dubai airport? Know viral 15-phone rule before you pack
content: Dubai International Airport (DXB) allows passengers to carry up to a limited number of portable electronic devices, including phones and laptops, per person. This regulation, driven by lithium battery safety concerns, requires devices to be switched off and properly packed. Travellers should protect spare batteries and consider carrying essential electronics in carry-on baggage for a smoother security experience.

title: Horoscope today: Daily astrological predictions for all zodiac signs
content: Horoscope Today: Read daily horoscope predictions for February 26, 2026. Know all about the astrological events and influences that will be affecting each of the 12 zodiac signs. Our astrologer has analyzed the movements of the planets and the alignment of the stars to bring you the most accurate and up-to-date horoscope predictions for the day ahead. Get ready to discover what the stars have in store for you today.

title: Oil market price battle: Russia & Iran offer heavy discounts to China as crude piles up at sea
content: Russian and Iranian oil producers are offering deeper discounts to Chinese buyers as India reduces its purchases.  Analysts note China's independent refiners are nearing capacity, leading to unsold oil piling up.  This situation impacts Russia's war funding and Iran's export efforts amid geopolitical tensions.

title: 'Speaker of the Knesset Medal': PM Modi conferred with Israel's highest parliamentary honour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received the prestigious "Speaker of the Knesset Medal," Israel's highest parliamentary honour, for bolstering strategic ties. He is the first Indian PM to be so recognized. This visit also saw him address the Israeli parliament for the first time, emphasizing friendship and partnership with the nation.

title: 'Pressure does funny things': Giant-killer Zimbabwe warn wounded India
content: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl believes the pressure of a must-win T20 World Cup match against India could affect the hosts. He highlighted Zimbabwe's diverse bowling attack as a potential advantage against India's strong batting lineup. Burl also confirmed captain Sikandar Raza is fit to play.

title: Trumponomics: Over a year into 2nd term, Donald‚Äôs economic policy shows mixed results
content: US President Donald Trump's second term sees a mixed economic picture: strong growth and tech investment clash with stalled job gains and inflation worries.  Supreme Court's tariff ruling adds uncertainty. While manufacturing output rises, factory jobs decline.  Affordability remains a concern for households despite overall economic momentum.

title: Delhi quadruple murder: Pregnant woman, three daughters found with throats slit; husband missing
content: A pregnant woman and her three young daughters were found murdered with their throats slit in their Delhi home. Police are searching for the woman's husband, a vegetable seller, who is the prime suspect and has been missing since the morning. The motive is under investigation, with potential angles including preference for a male child.

title: Nasa's ambitious Moon mission delayed: Artemis II rocket rolled back for repairs
content: NASA has rolled back its Artemis II moon rocket and Orion spacecraft from the launch pad to the Vehicle Assembly Building due to a new technical issue with the helium pressurisation system. This setback, following earlier hydrogen leaks, means the planned March launch window is now unattainable.

title: Cigarettes after tax: Smokers left fuming, tobacco black market lights up
content: India's recent steep cigarette tax hike has triggered immediate chaos, with prices soaring and supplies dwindling. Retailers are struggling, and consumers face inflated costs. This mirrors global trends where high taxes, without robust enforcement, fuel illicit trade and organized crime, potentially undermining public health goals and government revenue.

title: India & Israel will build iron alliance against threat of extremist Islam: Netanyahu
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced an "iron alliance" with India against extremist Islam, emphasizing shared values of moderation and human dignity. He lauded the "miraculous" bilateral relationship, highlighting doubled trade and tripled cooperation. Netanyahu expressed deep gratitude for India's support following the October 7th attack, calling Israel's campaign a "defensive war for the truth."

title: Dream of Karnataka govt. jobs brings youth in droves to Dharwad‚Äôs coaching centres and study halls
content: For long Dharwad has been the education hub of north Karnataka. Cashing on the brand name of Dharwad, over 30 coaching centres have come up here over the last few years

content: The Speaker had constituted the committee on August 12 last year after admitting a multi-party notice for the removal of the Allahabad High Court judge, setting in motion the process of his impeachment.

title: Karnataka High Court lays down procedure to access spouse‚Äôs income-tax returns in matrimonial disputes
content: The Karnataka High Court has issued comprehensive guidelines for spouses to obtain income tax returns and financial records of their partners in maintenance proceedings, as the law does not permit couples in matrimonial disputes to access each other‚Äôs financial data under the Right to Information Act

title: Govt. IVF services changing fertility landscape in Telangana; State-run hospitals log 190 infertility cases
content: This case comes amid a steady expansion of infertility services at government healthcare institutions in Telangana over the past year.

content: Videos of the accused in the murder riding pillion on local Trinamool Congress¬†MLA Gautam Chowdhury‚Äôs motorbike surfaced on social media

content: Around 32 lakh field functionaries will be deployed for census operations; satellite imagery will be used for clear identification of habitations and settlements

title: NIA arrests two more accused in Delhi car bomb blast case
content: The federal agency says the two are over ground workers of the Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind (AGH) terror outfit and allegedly supplied weapons to the prime accused in the case, Umar Un Nabi, who was also killed in the explosion

content: In three-day visit, the Home Minister will participate in various initiatives, including the inauguration of border outposts, and the e-inauguration and foundation laying of several works of the Sashastra Seema Bal

content: The series is aimed at benefiting undergraduate aspirants, postgraduate candidates, and working professionals in various fields such as humanities and sciences, entrepreneurship, law, public health, pharmacology, allied health sciences and nursing, medical and dental sciences, occupational therapy and physiotherapy, engineering, and agriculture.

content: Minister of State for Law and Justice Kaushik Vekariya said 50 people were externed and 39 properties linked to the accused, collectively valued at around ‚Çπ6 crore, were demolished

content: The medal was conferred in recognition of the Prime Minister‚Äôs exceptional contribution ‚Äî through his personal leadership ‚Äî to strengthen strategic relations between India and Israel

content: Commission moots sharing of Electronic Voting Machines (EVM), electoral rolls and the ECINET digital platform.

content: Videos of around 25 recent accidents, captured by CCTVs on the accident spots and those installed inside buses, from different parts of the State were screened

content: Prime Minister addresses the Israeli parliament as he begins visit to the West Asian country; India has an uncompromising policy of zero tolerance for terrorism with no double standard, he adds

content: Tariffs were collectively imposed on India, Indonesia and Laos following  investigation that is ongoing

title: BJP warns of protest if recruitment process is not initiated in Karnataka
content: Taking exception to the State government not going ahead with recruitments to government posts as promised by the Congress before the Assembly elections, BJP State president B.Y. Vijayendra warned of a protest if the recruitment process was not initiated

title: PM Modi condoles death of veteran CPI leader Nallakannu
content: R. Nallakannu died at a government hospital in Chennai due to age-related ailments; he was about 101 years old.

title: Kerala‚Äôs Puthur Zoological Park to open for public on February 28
content: To help visitors explore the park, two non-AC electric buses of the Kerala State Road Transport Corporation have been readied. 330 animals have been shifted to 14 habitats

title: YSRCP regime destroyed State, says Naidu
content: Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy played a false drama that Veligonda works were finished and dedicated the project to the nation without completing them, claims Chief Minister

title: YC urges Kerala Governor not to approve State govt. nominee as PSC member
content: Youth Congress State president criticises government‚Äôs decision to raise upper age limit for PSC examinations to 40, calling it misleading and unfair to existing job aspirants

title: Forest dept. for rejecting human-wildlife mitigation grant
content: The department has succumbed to threats from certain organisations acting under the guise of farmer interests to reject the project, which was initiated by the MoEFCC to alleviate tensions in areas outside tiger reserves, say Wayanad Prakrithi Samrakshana Samithi

title: AKSSA demands immediate recruitment to vacant posts
content: Karnataka State Students Association president Kanthakumar urges State govt. to immediately announce a clear recruitment schedule

title: Kerala‚Äôs fisherfolk 'army' gets valuable rescue lessons from NIWS Goa
content: Kerala Fisheries department has been funding the training of selected fishermen from the State in sea rescue at the National Institute of Water Sports. Presently the 24th batch is undergoing training

title: Body-worn cameras mandatory for passport verification; strict guidelines issued
content: Officials have been warned against expecting any favour, gratification, or engaging in harassment with the intention of demanding bribes

title: CM is giving misleading information on employment, says Arvind Bellad
content: The Deputy Leader of Opposition has accused Siddaramaiah of making claims about providing jobs even before completing the process

title: Ex-US Air Force Fighter Pilot Arrested For Training Chinese Military Personnel
content: Gerald Brown, 65, was arrested in Indiana after having recently returned to the United States from China, where he had been since December 2023, a Justice Department statement said.

title: Samsung Unveils Galaxy S26 Ultra With Built-In Privacy Display, AI Upgrades
content: Samsung Electronics Co. unveiled its Galaxy S26 lineup of smartphones, with an emphasis on artificial intelligence features and real-world privacy over major design changes.

title: Cuba Kills 4 On US-Registered Speedboat That Opened Fire On Soldiers
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Washington was seeking its own facts about the shooting and would "respond accordingly."

title: A Secret Chinese Campaign Was Exposed By 1 Mistake: Using ChatGPT As A Diary
content: You should never trust an AI chatbot with your deepest, darkest secrets. A Chinese law enforcement official learned this the hard way when they decided to use ChatGPT as their personal diary.

title: Class 10 Student Delivers Baby During Board Exam In Madhya Pradesh
content: In a shocking incident reported from Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district, a minor girl studying in Class 10 delivered a baby boy during her board examination at an exam centre in Pithampur, a police officer said.

title: Admit Card With Pass Certificate Can Be Accepted: Top Court On Bengal SIR
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday directed electoral authorities in West Bengal to ensure the submission of pending verification documents by 5 pm on February 26 to judicial officers overseeing the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls.

title: Speaker Om Birla Re-Constitutes Panel To Probe Judge In Cash Row
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has re-constituted a three-member committee to investigate the corruption allegations against Justice Yashwant Varma, the judge of the Allahabad High Court, at whose home piles of burnt cash was found.

title: Armed Robbers Loot Jewellery Worth Rs 60 Lakh In Delhi's Chandni Chowk
content: Three armed assailants looted gold jewellery worth approximately Rs 60 lakh from a shop in the Kinari Bazar area of Chandni Chowk in Delhi on Wednesday.

title: Rajasthan Cabinet Removes 2-Child Norm For Local Body Polls After 3 Decades
content: In a significant policy shift, the Rajasthan Cabinet on Wednesday approved the removal of the decades-old two-child norm for contesting Panchayati Raj and urban local body elections, ending a restriction that had been in place for nearly 30 years.

title: "It Was A Mistake": Lucknow Man Who Murdered Father, Chopped His Body
content: "It happened by mistake," the 21-year-old, accused of killing his father and dismembering the body, said on Wednesday while being taken to a local court amid tight security.

title: No Cockpit Voice, Flight Data Recorder In Plane That Crashed In Jharkhand
content: The nearly 40-year-old Beechcraft C90A aircraft that crashed in Jharkhand on Monday, killing seven people, did not have cockpit voice or flight data recorders, according to the aviation regulator DGCA.

title: "Modi Hug Is Special": Netanyahu's High Praise For "Brother" PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's trademark "hugplomacy", where he embraces world leaders in his trademark hug, has once again drawn international attention after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu praised what he called the famous "Modi hug".

title: Over 5,000 Tribals Join BJP In Assam's Goalpara, Weeks Before Elections
content: A massive joining programme was organised by the BJP ST Morcha, Assam Pradesh, at the Agia School playground in Goalpara district on February 25.

title: Anti-Terror Agency NIA Arrests 2 More In Red Fort Blast Case
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has apprehended two more terror operatives allegedly involved in the Delhi Red Fort area bomb blast conspiracy, taking the total number of arrests in the case to 11.

title: Drama Follows Youth Congress Workers' Arrest, Cops File Case Against Cops
content: A confrontation between two state police forces unfolded on a highway in Himachal Pradesh on Saturday, escalating into a rare situation in which one police unit registered a criminal case against officers from another state.

title: 'Kerala' In Use From 2nd-Century BC: Shashi Tharoor's History Lesson On Name Change
content: The renaming of "Kerala" to "Keralam" is not just a "trivial" issue to focus on when key issues are going unattended, it also jettison's a name with far more antiquity, senior Congress leader and Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor has told NDTV.

title: "Windpipes Were Cut": Delhi Man Slits Throats Of Pregnant Wife, 3 Daughters
content: A man allegedly slit the throats of his two-month pregnant wife and three daughters at their residence in the outer north area of the national capital, with police suspecting that his preference for a son could be behind the killings.

title: Cuts On Lips, Eye: 2-Year-Old Girl Mauled By Stray Dog In Maharashtra
content: A two-year-old girl sustained severe injuries, including deep cuts on her lips, cheeks, and eye, after she was attacked by a stray dog in Maharashtra's Ahilyanagar on Wednesday.

title: In Mumbai Civic Body's Rs 81,000-Crore Budget, Big Infra, Education Push
content: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has presented a massive Rs 80,952.56 crore budget for the 2026-27 fiscal year, marking an 8.77 per cent increase over last year's Rs 74,427.41 crore outlay.

title: Inflation To 'Killers': Fake Claims In Trump's State Of The Union Address
content: US President Donald Trump delivered the longest address to Congress in modern history, speaking for one hour and 47 minutes while declaring that the "country is winning again".

title: Why did Israeli opposition walk out during PM Modi's Knesset visit?
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: SC stays proceedings against Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren for defying ED summons
content: a bench issued notice to ED and asked the agency to file its response in four weeks . it allowed Soren to file a rejoinder three weeks thereafter . a senior advocate says this was a case of gross abuse of power by ED .

title: After SC rap, NCERT nixes portion on judicial corruption
content: the national council of educational research and training moved to drop references of "corruption at various levels of the judiciary" the board said it has put on hold the distribution of the newly released social science textbook after "inappropriate textual material and error of judgement" were noticed . the issue was flagged both internally and by the department of school education and literacy under the education ministry .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Will the Wolves rise? Where all 30 teams land after All-Star break
content: the race for the playoffs is heating up in the East and the West . the team are neck and neck with the defending champions Oklahoma City Thunder . but things could catch up to the Thunder because of injuring a player .

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: Trade grades: What can Brett Kulak do for the Avalanche?
content: the 2025-26 NHL trade season continues now that the Olympics and the Olympic roster freeze are over . the Vancouver Canucks traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights in exchange for a package that included defenseman Zach Whitecloud .

title: PM Modi, Netanyahu discuss range of issues aimed at boosting bilateral relation
content: new: "it is a delight to be back in Israel after nine years," modi says . new: the two leaders hold a brief one-on-one meeting with the pm . he was welcomed at the airport in Tel Aviv by his counterpart and his wife .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: Ranking all 30 MLB lineups for 2026
content: Hall of Famer Rogers Hornsby uttered a romantic quote . "people ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball," he said . he swaps cards from team to team, envisioning what the next summer would look like .

title: Hooked on hockey after the Olympics? An updated look at the NHL's playoff picture
content: the NHL paused its season to allow its players to compete in the 2026 winter Olympics in Italy . around 143 players saw action in the Olympic men's hockey tournament . some return as bitter runners-ups, others as new minted gold medalists .

title: Between swipe and scroll, shorter focus & higher stress, finds study
content: Anuja Jaiswal is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, with an impressive 18-year career in narrative journalism. She specializes in health and heritage reporting, expertly simplifying complex health information to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Her deep dives into heritage topics are well-researched, resulting in captivating narratives that resonate with her audience. Over the years, she has worked in Chandigarh, Chhattisgarh and West UP, gaining diverse on-ground experience that shapes her storytelling. Read More

title: MMA divisional rankings: Heavyweight top 10 is light on changes or impact
content: the heavyweight division is seriously lacking in depth and activity at the top . the fight ended prematurely as a no-contest after he suffered eye pokes that required surgery and threaten to end his career . it's not going to stay in a valley forever, but MMA fans will await that day eagerly .

title: Security forces recover IEDs, ammo in J&K‚Äôs Poonch
content:
JAMMU: A joint team of the Army and J&K Police on Wednesday recovered two Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) and assorted ammunition during an anti-terror exercise, codenamed Operation Ghani, in Poonch district, the Army stated. ‚ÄúBased on synergised intelligence inputs from own sources and J&K Police, a joint operation was launched by the troops of White Knight Corps and Special Operations Group of J&K Police in Gani forest area in Poonch,‚Äù the Army‚Äôs White Knight Corps stated in an X post. The searches led to the discovery of an arms cache concealed beneath a natural cave, the post said. ‚ÄúOne big IED weighing 4.5kg, one small IED weighing 800g, two Chinese grenades, one 9mm pistol, two 9mm rounds, and 22 rounds of 7.62mm ammunition were recovered from the site,‚Äù an Army spokesperson said. The explosives and ammunition were destroyed in situ by a bomb disposal team.

End of Article
